column1: <!-- generated by issue reporter -->",2025-07-21T05:58:24Z,open,https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/257000,Anger,Negative,"The email body appears to be a bug report with a clear description of the issue (""please do not show those suggestions"") and includes technical details such as error codes, version numbers, and system information. The tone is formal and objective, but the presence of a bug report typically implies a negative experience or issue with the product or service. The sentiment is not extremely negative (e.g., ""Very Negative"") because the tone remains professional and does not contain aggressive language. The emotion-based sentiment of Anger is inferred because the report describes a problem (bug) that the user is experiencing, which can evoke frustration or irritation. However, the tone does not explicitly express anger."

column1: <!-- generated by issue reporter -->",2025-07-21T05:46:16Z,open,https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/256999,Frustration/Anger ( leaning towards Anger),Negative,"The email body reports a bug and provides a detailed reproducible example, indicating a problem with the functionality of ""Refactor"" -> ""Move ..."" in the user's experience. However, given the provided emotion categories, 'Anger' seems to best capture the sentiment behind reporting a bug that causes inconvenience."
3247279585,"Copilot's Workspace Index forever stays in ""Checking index status""","<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates -->
<!-- Please attach logs to help us diagnose your issue -->
- Copilot Chat Extension Version: Chat v0.29.1, Copilot v1.344.0,
1. Go to the Copilot icon in the bottom right of VS Code
4. Note how it always says ""checking index status""

I have a repo on Bitbucket that I'm using. Therefore I cannot use a remote index. I also think the repo is too big to be a local index. However, I am noticing that the Workspace Index forever tells me ""Checking index status"".

I have tried to execute the command _Github Copilot: Build local workspace index_ through the Command Palette. After 8+ hours, it is apparently still busy building the index, which seems way too long for me.
Both of these observations are giving me the assumption that absolutely nothing is happening regarding the Workspace Index. I have tried restarting my computer, but I can't get past this status.
I really hope this can be fixed, because I am noticing that Copilot's autocomplete suggestions are questionable and I hope that will be better once the index is fixed.

,2025-07-21T05:38:19Z,open,https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/256998,Frustration (which can be classified under Anger or Sadness, but most closely aligns with Anger)",Negative,"The email body expresses a clear problem the user is facing with the Workspace Index feature of Copilot, detailing a stuck process and a significant amount of time wasted trying to resolve the issue. The user's frustration is evident through their description of the issue, attempts to troubleshoot, and the impact on their experience with Copilot's autocomplete suggestions. The tone is not overly aggressive but clearly indicates dissatisfaction and irritation, aligning with a Negative sentiment and an emotion-based sentiment of Anger."

The user's sentiment can be classified as neutral, as they are simply providing information and assistance, but the underlying emotion is sadness or frustration due to the issue at hand. The user's mention of being upset about the flagging of their issue also supports the classification of sadness as the emotion-based sentiment."
